## Input the Hotels.csv file

```{r warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
hotels <- read_csv("hotels.csv")
hotels <- read_csv(file.choose())

head(hotels)
names(hotels)

```
## Select a variable

```{r}
select(hotels, hotel, lead_time)
hotels %>%
  select(hotel, lead_time) %>%
  arrange(desc(lead_time))
```
## Select a range of variable

```{r}
hotels %>%
  select(hotel:arrival_date_month)
hotels %>%
  select(starts_with("arrival"))
```
## Select a range of rows / cases

```{r}
hotels %>%
  #We will select 1st, 5th, 8th and 10th row
  slice(c(1, 5, 8, 10))
hotels %>%
  filter(hotel == "City Hotel")
hotels %>%
  filter( 
    adults == 0,
    children >= 1
    ) %>% 
  select(adults, babies, children)
# bookings with no adults and some children or babies in the room
hotels %>%
  filter( 
    adults == 0,     
    children >= 1 | babies >= 1     # | means or
    ) %>%
  select(adults, babies, children)
```
## Summarizing

```{r}
hotels %>%
  count(market_segment)
hotels %>%
  count(hotel, market_segment)
```
## Mutation

```{r}
hotels %>%
  mutate(little_ones = children + babies) %>%
  select(children, babies, little_ones) %>%
  arrange(desc(little_ones))

little_ones <- hotels
little_ones %<>%
  mutate(little_ones = children + babies) %>%
  select(children, babies, little_ones) %>%
  arrange(desc(little_ones))
```

## Summary

```{r}
hotels %>%
  group_by(hotel) %>%
  summarise(mean_adr = mean(adr))

summary <- hotels %>%
group_by(hotel) %>%
  summarise(mean_adr = mean(adr))
summary
```
